docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs
docs.text: For full documentation visit mkdocs.org.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Style 1
docs.text:
• HTML for content and structure
  • JavaScript for interactivity
  • CSS for text running out of boxes
  • Internet Explorer ... huh?

docs.title: Style 2
docs.text:
• Set up in 5 minutes

Install mkdocs-material with pip and get up and running in minutes

Getting started

  • It's just Markdown

Focus on your content and generate a responsive and searchable static site

Reference

  • Made to measure

Change the colors, fonts, language, icons, logo and more with a few lines

Customization

  • Open Source, MIT

Material for MkDocs is licensed under MIT and available on [GitHub]

License

docs.title: Style 3
docs.text:
Unordered listOrdered list
  • Sed sagittis eleifend rutrum
  • Donec vitae suscipit est
  • Nulla tempor lobortis orci
  1. Sed sagittis eleifend rutrum
  2. Donec vitae suscipit est
  3. Nulla tempor lobortis orci
Content tabs
=== "Unordered list"

    * Sed sagittis eleifend rutrum
    * Donec vitae suscipit est
    * Nulla tempor lobortis orci

=== "Ordered list"

    1. Sed sagittis eleifend rutrum
    2. Donec vitae suscipit est
    3. Nulla tempor lobortis orci

docs.title: Plain codeblock
docs.text:
A plain codeblock:

Some code here
def myfunction()
// some comment

docs.title: Code for a specific language
docs.text:
Some more code with the py at the start:

import tensorflow as tf
def whatever()

docs.title: With a title
With line numbers
docs.text:
def bubble_sort(items):
    for i in range(len(items)):
        for j in range(len(items) - 1 - i):
            if items[j] > items[j + 1]:
                items[j], items[j + 1] = items[j + 1], items[j]

docs.title: Highlighting lines
docs.text:
def bubble_sort(items):
    for i in range(len(items)):
        for j in range(len(items) - 1 - i):
            if items[j] > items[j + 1]:
                items[j], items[j + 1] = items[j + 1], items[j]

docs.title: Code Documentation With MkDocs
docs.text: This is a simple example of how to use MkDocs to generate documentation for your code.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
To install MkDocs, run the following command:

  • Create a virtual environment
python -m venv venv
  • Activate the virtual environment
.\venv\Scripts\Activate
  • Install MkDocs
pip install mkdocs-material
  • Install Server
mkdocs new .
  • Run the server
mkdocs serve
  • Setup GitHub Pages
